alert.note: Alert for Blaine (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 11 at 8:09PM MDT until April 15 at 3:30PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Montana... Milk River near Harlem affecting Blaine County. Big Sandy Creek at Havre affecting Hill County. .Warm temperatures will melt snowpack and increase river flows. For the Milk River...including Harlem...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Big Sandy Creek...including Havre...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Milk River near Harlem. * WHEN...Until Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 21.0 feet, At 21 Feet...the Milk River near Harlem is bankfull. Some minor problems can occur near the river from Chinook to east of Harlem. Impacts start to go up quickly as the stage goes above 21 feet. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM MDT Tuesday the stage was 21.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:30 PM MDT Tuesday was 21.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 22.6 feet early Thursday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 22.4 feet on May 22, 1974. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning at 1000 AM MDT.
